document.masterDocTitle: Description of new members of the family Cylindroleberididae (Ostracoda: Cylindroleberidoidea) from the Southern Ocean

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of new members of the family Cylindroleberididae (Ostracoda: Cylindroleberidoidea) from the Southern Ocean

subSubSection.paragraph:
1975
Parasterope styx
, new species Kornicker: 432–436 , figs. 270, 271 .
Stat. 42 - 2 : ZMH-K- 41909 —immature male (length 2.10 mm ).

First antenna (
Fig. 10
C, D). First joint with list of faint spines near ventral margin; 2 nd joint with spines forming clusters on lateral surface, 1 long seta on dorsal margin with long proximal and short distal marginal spines, and 1 short distal bare lateral seta near dorsal margin; 3 rd joint with 1 short seta on ventral margin and 6 long spinous setae on dorsal margin; 3 rd plus 4 th joint somewhat longer than wide; 4 th joint with 1 long seta (with short marginal spines) near dorsal margin and 2 midlength bare setae on ventral margin; sensory seta of 5 th joint with 6 filaments ( 4 proximal and 2 distal); seta of 6 th limb slightly longer than a-claw of 7 th limb. 7 th joint (
Fig. 10
C): aclaw bare, b-seta with 3 proximal and 2 terminal filaments, c-seta broken. 8 th joint (
Fig. 10
C): d-seta minute, e-seta bare, f-seta with 16 short proximal and 2 long terminal filaments, g-seta with 6 long proximal and 2 long terminal filaments.

Second antenna (
Fig. 10
E–H). Protopodite with short slender medial seta (
Fig. 10
f). Endopodite: 3 -jointed; 1 st and 2 nd joints bare; 3 rd joint with proximal ventral seta with blunt tip.

Mandible (
Figs. 11
A–D; 12 A–D, G). Ventral branch of coxale endite broken and lost. Basale endite with glandular peg, 4 terminal spinous setae, only 2 triaenid setae and 1 dwarf seta about three-fifth the length of triaenid seta (
Fig. 12
C, D). Basale: ventral margin with U-shaped sclerotized area and with minute thick spines, dorsal margin without midlength setae. Exopodite with hirsute tip and only 1 short subterminal seta not quite reaching end of 1 st endopodite joint (
Fig. 12
A, B). Endopodite: 1 st joint with 3 long spinous ventral setae; dorsal margin of 2 nd joint with single spinous proximal seta about half length of a-seta, and spinous a- (or a 1 - and a 2 - setae on right limb, see
Fig. 11
D), b-, c-, and d-setae, 1 short and 1 long seta between b- and c-setae, 1 seta below d-seta; medial surface with 2–3 cleaning setae between b- and c-setae.

Maxilla (
Fig. 12
F, E). Epipodial appendage slightly hirsute. Proximal and distal endites each with 3 long spinous setae. Basale: dorsal surface hirsute; medial surface with 1 proximal seta near base of epipodite; lateral seta absent (?); dorsal margin with 1 seta; ventral margin with 1 proximal and 1 distal seta; 1 st endopodite joint with 1 short dorsal and 1 long ventral seta; 2 nd joint with long terminal seta; suture between 1 st and 2 nd joints indistinct.

Fifth limb (
Fig. 13
A, B). Epipodial appendage with about 60 plumose setae. Comb with long setules and 3 short and 1 long bare setae near ventral margin. Exopodial stout plumose seta reaching past end of comb and with small swelling in middle.

Sixth limb (
Fig. 13
C, D). Antero-ventral corner with 2 short bare setae; anterior without seta at lower suture, but with 5 medial short bare setae, postero-ventral margin with 16 spinous setae.

Seventh limb (
Fig. 13
E). Limb with 12 setae, 9 in proximal group ( 4 + 5 ) and 3 in distal group ( 1 + 2 ); each seta with 3 bells; opposing combs of terminus each with 7 teeth with bifurcate tip.

Caudal furca (
Fig. 13
F, G). Left lamella with 5 claws and 3 posterior setae, and right lamella with 6 claws and 2 posterior setae; posterior margin of each lamella and adjacent margin of body with minute spines.

Medial and Lateral eyes (
Fig. 10
A, B). Medial eye large with brown central part. Lateral eyes absent.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9.
Parasterope cf. styx
(Immature male—ZMH-K-41909: A–D) and
Bathyleberis grossmani
(Adult female—E). Alateral view of right valve, B—rostrum and anterior infold of left valve, C—list and posterior margin of right valve, D—central adductor muscle attachments, E—lateral view of left valve.

FIGURE 10.
Parasterope cf. styx
(Immature male—ZMH-K-41909). A—medial eye and rod-shaped organ, B—1st antenna, medial eye, rod-shaped organ, anterior body and upper lip, C—distal part of 1st antenna, D—terminal part of 1st antenna, E—2nd antenna, F—short medial seta on protopodite of 2nd antenna, G—distal part of exopodite on 2nd antenna, H and I—endopodite of 2nd antenna.

FIGURE 11.
Parasterope cf. styx
(Immature male—ZMH-K-41909). A—mandible (only main setae shown), B—endopodite and exopodite of mandible, C and D—dorsal surface of 2nd endopodite segment of mandible.

FIGURE 12.
Parasterope
cf.
styx
(Immature male—ZMH-K-41909). A—exopodite and 1st endopodite segment of mandible, B—exopodite mandible, C and D—basale endite of mandible, E and F maxilla, G—ventral surface of basale of mandible.

FIGURE 13.
Parasterope
cf.
styx
(Immature male—ZMH-K-41909). A and B—comb and exopodial seta of 5th limb, C—6th limb, D—ventral and antero-ventral margins of 6th limb, E—7th limb, F—6th– 8th pairs of furcal claws and posterior part of body, G—left caudal furca and posterior part of body.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Rod-shaped organ (
Fig. 10
A, B). 2 -jointed; 1 st joint very short, 2 nd joint long and rounded tip. Upper lip (
Fig. 10
A). Lip consisting of two hirsute lobes each lobe with 2 spines; flap present on each side of mouth.

Remarks. Our specimen somewhat differs from specimen described by
Kornicker 1975
(see
Table 5
).

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 5. The morphological comparison of the female
Parasterope styx
(Kornicker´s specimen) and immature male P . сf.
styx
(our specimen).

subSubSection.paragraph: Character Female (Kornicker immature male

1975 ) (herein) Carapace length (mm) 2.01 2.10 number setae in row above incisur 11 14 number setae between list and incisor 14 2 number transparent setae on infold behind rostrum 40–50 18 between list and outer margin
First antenna filaments on g-seta 6 8 Mandible number triaenid setae on basale endite 3 2

ventral setae on comb 5 4–6 Sixth limb seta on anterior margin 6–7 5 setae in antero-ventral corner 1 2 Distribution . The species was collected at the type-locality, on the crest of the west rise of the Peru-Chile Trench and the Scotia Sea at depth range 3670–4303 m .
